item.title: Day 121, 2 Samuel 5, 1 Chronicles 11-12
item.description: At this point in time, Israel approached David in Hebron and requested him to be king. David made a covenant with the people of Israel - his kingship was a covenantal relationship between himself and Israel.

item.title: Day 119, 1 Chronicles 7-10
item.description: The author recounts the genealogies of the tribes of Issachar, Benjamin, Naphtali, Manasseh, Ephraim, and Asher. Each genealogy is of varying lengths with varying degrees of detail, likely reflecting the sources that were accessible to the author.

item.title: Day 117, 1 Chronicles 6
item.description: The author recounts the genealogy of Levi. Of the sons of Kohath came Aaron, Moses, and Ahitub. The line of Kohath was recorded until the exile by Babylon.

item.title: Day 115, 1 Chronicles 3-5
item.description: Chapter 3 through 5 follow the genealogies of the tribes of Judah, Simeon, Reuban, Gad, and Manasseh. Chapter 3 also recounts the genealogy of David.

item.title: Day 113, 1 Chronicles 1-2
item.description: 1 Chronicles opens up with a genealogy from Adam to David. This makes sense as the book of Chronicles was written while Israel was in exile.
